The figure shows a schematic diagram of a play activity with a metal guide rail at an angle α, a narrow groove with a small ball, and a rope connected to a pillow and a child.

Identify forces: gravity acts downward on the pillow and child, tension in the rope acts on the pillow-child system and the ball, and the only horizontal force is the component of gravity along the incline.
Resolve forces: total mass of the pillow and child is m1 + m2.
Gravitational force on the pillow-child system is (m1 + m2)g.
Component of gravitational force along the incline is (m1 + m2)g sin α.
Component of gravitational force perpendicular to the incline is (m1 + m2)g cos α.
Tension in the rope T balances the component of gravitational force along the incline: T = (m1 + m2)g sin α.
Force exerted by the pillow on the child is the normal force due to gravity acting perpendicular to the incline: F_pillow on child = (m1 + m2)g cos α.
Determine the ratio of tension in the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child: Ratio = (m1 + m2)g sin α / (m1 + m2)g cos α = tan α.
Final answer: The ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is tan α.
